requirements.description: Facts in Complaint deemed true for purposes of determining non-dischargeability
requirements.quoted_text: B. For the purpose of any subsequent civil litigation, including but not limited to, a non-dischargeability complaint filed by the Division in any subsequent proceeding, the facts alleged in the Complaint will be taken as true and deemed established.

requirements.description: Facts establish all elements for non-dischargeability judgment under bankruptcy law
requirements.quoted_text: C. The facts as alleged in the Complaint establish all elements necessary to sustain an action by the Division pursuant to Section 523(a)(2)(A) of the Bankruptcy Code, 11 U.S.C. § 523(a)(2)(A), and this Order will have collateral estoppel effect for such purposes.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendants must deliver copies of the Order to personnel and obtain signed acknowledgments for 10 years.

requirements.description: Each defendant must submit signed acknowledgment within 7 days
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendants must obtain acknowledgments of receipt of this Order: A. Each Defendant, within seven (7) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission and Division an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order sworn under penalty of perjury.

requirements.description: For 10 years, deliver Order to principals, officers, managers, and employees with managerial responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days
requirements.quoted_text: B. For ten (10) years after the entry of this Order, Defendants must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Reporting. Delivery must occur within seven (7) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities. C. From each individual or entity to which a Defendant delivered a copy of this Order, that Defendant must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit compliance reports to the FTC and Utah, notify of changes within 14 days, and report bankruptcy filings.

requirements.description: Submit compliance report one year after entry sworn under penalty of perjury
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendants make timely submissions to the Commission and Division: A. One (1) year after the entry of this Order, each Defendant must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which each Defendant: 1. Identifies the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission and Division may use to communicate with Defendant; 2. Identifies all of that Defendant's businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; 3. Describes the activities of each business, including the goods and services offered, and the means of advertising, marketing, and sales; 4. Describes in detail whether and how that Defendant is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and 5. Provides a copy of each Order Acknowledgment obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission or Division.

requirements.description: For 10 years, notify Commission and Division of changes within 14 days
requirements.quoted_text: B. For ten (10) years after the entry of this Order, each Defendant must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: 1. Any designated point of contact; or 2. The structure of any Defendant that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Report bankruptcy filings within 14 days
requirements.quoted_text: C. Each Defendant must submit to the Commission and Division notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against such Defendant within fourteen (14) days of its filing.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must create and retain specified records for compliance verification for 10 years creation period and 5 years retention period.

requirements.description: Create certain records for 10 years and retain for 5 years from creation
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendants must create certain records for ten (10) years after the entry of the Order, and retain each such record for five (5) years, unless otherwise specified below. Specifically, Defendants, for any business that they, individually or collectively, are a majority owner or that they directly or indirectly manage or control, must create and retain the following records: A. Accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold; B. Personnel records showing, for each person providing services in relation to any aspect of the Order, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person's: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination; C. Records of all consumer complaints and refund requests, whether received directly or indirectly, such as through a third party, and any response; D. All records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission or Division

requirements.description: Retain copies of advertisements and marketing materials for 5 years
requirements.quoted_text: E. A copy of each unique advertisement or other marketing material making a representation subject to this Order; F. For five (5) years after the date of preparation of each Privacy and Security Assessment or CSAM and NCM Prevention Assessment required under Provisions III, IV, IX, or X of this Order, all materials relied upon to prepare the assessment, whether prepared by or on behalf of Defendants, including, but not limited to, all plans, reports, studies, reviews, audits, audit trails, policies, training materials, and assessments

requirements.description: Retain communications with law enforcement for 5 years from receipt
requirements.quoted_text: G. For five (5) years from the date of receipt or transmission, copies of all communications to or from any law enforcement agency related to the subject matter of this Order

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC and Utah Division have the right to monitor compliance through various means including document requests, depositions, and site access.

requirements.description: Submit compliance reports and documents within 14 days of request
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendants must permit representatives of the Commission and Division to interview any employee or other person affiliated with any Defendant who has agreed to such an interview for purposes related to this Order. The person interviewed may have counsel present. A. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission's or Division's lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1. Nothing in this Order limits the Division's lawful use of compulsory process pursuant to Utah Code sections 13-2-5, 6, and 13-11-8, 16, 17.

requirements.description: FTC and Utah may communicate directly with defendants without representation present
requirements.quoted_text: B. The Commission and Division may communicate directly with each Defendant, unless the Defendant retains counsel related to the subject matter of this Order.

requirements.description: FTC and Utah may pose as consumers or suppliers
requirements.quoted_text: C. Representatives of the Commission and Division may pose as consumers and suppliers to Defendants, their employees, or any other entity managed or controlled in whole or in part by any Defendant, without the necessity of identification or prior notice.

requirements.description: Defendants must not transfer management to evade Order requirements
requirements.quoted_text: D. Defendants will not take any action, enter into any agreement, or assist any other party to transfer the management or operation of www.pornhub.com or any other Covered Service in any manner that is intended to evade, or could reasonably be expected to evade, any requirements set forth in this Order.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction for construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.

requirements.description: Court retains jurisdiction for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.

duration.termination_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
